Package com.transifex.txnative.missingpolicy

Class PseudoTranslationPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.transifex.txnative.missingpolicy.PseudoTranslationPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MissingPolicy
    public class PseudoTranslationPolicy
extends Object
implements MissingPolicy
    Returns a string that looks like the source string but contains accented characters.

    Example:

    get("The quick brown fox");

    returns:

    "Ťȟê ʠüıċǩ ƀȓøẁñ ƒøẋ"

    • Method Detail

      • get

        @NonNull
public CharSequence get​(@NonNull
                        CharSequence sourceString,
                        @StringRes
                        int id,
                        @NonNull
                        String resourceName,
                        @NonNull
                        String locale)
        Returns a string that looks somewhat like the source string.

        Note that Spanned objects are converted to simple Strings when processed and will lose their markup.

        Specified by:
        get in interface MissingPolicy
        Parameters:
        sourceString - The source string.
        id - The string resource identifier as defined by Resources.getIdentifier(String, String, String).
        resourceName - The entry name of the string resource as defined by Resources.getResourceEntryName(int).
        locale - The current locale as returned by LocaleState.getResolvedLocale().
        Returns:
        The translated string.

      • getQuantityString

        @NonNull
public CharSequence getQuantityString​(@NonNull
                                      CharSequence sourceQuantityString,
                                      @PluralsRes
                                      int id,
                                      int quantity,
                                      @NonNull
                                      String resourceName,
                                      @NonNull
                                      String locale)
        Returns a quantity string that looks somewhat like the source string.

        Note that Spanned objects are converted to simple Strings when processed and will lose their markup.

        Specified by:
        getQuantityString in interface MissingPolicy
        Parameters:
        sourceQuantityString - The source string having grammatically correct pluralization for the given quantity.
        id - The plurals resource identifier as defined by Resources.getIdentifier(String, String, String).
        quantity - The number used to get the correct string for the current language's plural rules.
        resourceName - The entry name of the plurals resource as defined by Resources.getResourceEntryName(int).
        locale - The current locale as returned by LocaleState.getResolvedLocale().
        Returns:
        The translated string.
